meanings.definition: Relating to a theca or thecae.
meanings.sent1: The thecal shell was hard and durable.
meanings.sent2: The thecal membrane surrounded the delicate structure.
meanings.sent3: The thecal design on the phone case was quite stylish.
meanings.sent4: Her thecal approach to problem-solving was methodical and precise.
meanings.sent5: The thecal pattern on the fabric was intricate and beautiful.

meanings.sent1: The thecal shield protected the ancient artifact.
meanings.sent2: The thecal of the flower kept the seeds safe.
meanings.sent3: He stored his valuables in a thecal to keep them secure.
meanings.sent4: The knight's armor was like a thecal, guarding him in battle.
meanings.sent5: The thecal of the book was worn from years of use.
